body:
Since coming across [this post](https://ruqqus.com/post/14ee/a-categorized-list-of-apolitical-guilds) I've been trying to figure out a way to make a decent, filterable list of the growing amount of guilds so people can find them a bit easier.

Started out with a plain list on GitHub but filtering wasn't really possible.  Tried it out in Notion and while it seems to work just fine, the filtering elements of the table do not seem to work from the public side.  

I found a solution in Roam Research and wanted to share that link with you guys here.

https://roamresearch.com/#/app/ruqqus/page/sMhgGHZpW

The filtering option is located next to the search field on the upper right hand corner: ![IMAGE](https://i.maga.host/YDBOsON.png)

Any tips or insights are appreciated.  Keep in mind, I started this in the last 72 hours and have bounced between Notion and Roam Research to try and get this done efficiently for everyone.  That is to say, this is sort of a work-in-progress.  Trying to do my best here, learning new things along the way as I'm not the greatest at Roam.


Thank you.

body:
I've just been adding things as I see them, and following the comments in the two places OP originally posted his list.  Originally I tried to do this with Notion so other people could join and help with the list easier (as Roam is not free) but the filtering options are only available to the public on Notion if you're on a Enterprise plan if I'm not mistaken.

The places I have left this link, I plan to keep an eye on the comments for stuff to add and have been also keeping an eye on +RequestAGuild for new things that get created there, and I have started dumping links from this guild into Atom to add to it as well.

Was tossing around the idea of trying to come up with a sort of form people could fill out to have stuff added to it.

Since coming across [this post](https://ruqqus.com/post/14ee/a-categorized-list-of-apolitical-guilds) I've been trying to figure out a way to make a decent, filterable list of the growing amount of guilds so people can find them a bit easier.

Started out with a plain list on GitHub but filtering wasn't really possible.  Tried it out in Notion and while it seems to work just fine, the filtering elements of the table do not seem to work from the public side.  

I found a solution in Roam Research and wanted to share that link with you guys here.

https://roamresearch.com/#/app/ruqqus/page/sMhgGHZpW

The filtering option is located next to the search field on the upper right hand corner: ![IMAGE](https://i.maga.host/YDBOsON.png)

Any tips or insights are appreciated.  Keep in mind, I started this in the last 72 hours and have bounced between Notion and Roam Research to try and get this done efficiently for everyone.  That is to say, this is sort of a work-in-progress.  Trying to do my best here, learning new things along the way as I'm not the greatest at Roam.


Thank you.

body:
Check out [Obsidian](https://obsidian.md/), too.

Couple guys have also whipped up [a version of this functionality](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=kortina.vscode-markdown-notes) for [VS Code](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/) but it doesn't really feel like Roam or Obsidian.  Personally, I'm more of an [Atom](https://atom.io/) guy myself.

There is also [Joplin](https://joplinapp.org/) and [nvUltra](https://nvultra.com/).  There is heavy argument that they're all just trying to mimic Roam, with the excpetion of Jopling which is a huge elbow smash to Evernote in all the right ways.  nvUltra is still hot it's so new, waiting list only status.

The main brain behind Obsidian as far as I can understand is a former employee of [DynaList](https://dynalist.io/) which was supposed to be a more markdown friendly version of [Workflowy](https://workflowy.com/).  Roam is by far the farthest ahead in all these arenas.

Been deep into Roam for almost two weeks now after six weeks of heavily investing time into Obsidian.  This is what my graph looks like for my personal Roam as of yesterday: ![IMAGE](https://i.maga.host/DUSsYrP.png)

post.body:
Since coming across [this post](https://ruqqus.com/post/14ee/a-categorized-list-of-apolitical-guilds) I've been trying to figure out a way to make a decent, filterable list of the growing amount of guilds so people can find them a bit easier.

Started out with a plain list on GitHub but filtering wasn't really possible.  Tried it out in Notion and while it seems to work just fine, the filtering elements of the table do not seem to work from the public side.  

I found a solution in Roam Research and wanted to share that link with you guys here.

https://roamresearch.com/#/app/ruqqus/page/sMhgGHZpW

The filtering option is located next to the search field on the upper right hand corner: ![IMAGE](https://i.maga.host/YDBOsON.png)

Any tips or insights are appreciated.  Keep in mind, I started this in the last 72 hours and have bounced between Notion and Roam Research to try and get this done efficiently for everyone.  That is to say, this is sort of a work-in-progress.  Trying to do my best here, learning new things along the way as I'm not the greatest at Roam.


Thank you.
